rdBQgDpC5qgWnkW5X7_mXg.text: Service person was good but food was not. Fries were cold. And with my steak the vegetables were also cold. There was a guy outside on a bench selling cold beer .. what is up with that part of Tryon street?? Can't go there again

Jpfn-_58RRwR11wS4TL22Q.text: Right next to RiRa's on Tryon, the cocktails and food were excellent, we had a large party and the staff was great and responsive. Would recommend!

5iDOAn2Y5ZT5T-dH49S5eg.text: Amazing food. Had the Nashville fried chicken dinner, fried green tomatoes and duck fat potatoes. Unreal. Highly recommend!

_VSspDoX6IPKSAFl-Y6asg.text: Meh... not so much. Tried the calamari, fried green tomatoes, wedge salad, and filet. Calamari was fine, well seasoned and sauce had a little kick. Tomatoes were ok, a lot going on with them but nothing stood out. Salad was good but if you can't make a wedge salad that's scary. Filet was cooked well to a medium rare but lacked any flavor along with mashed potatoes and broccoli. None of the food was bad, it just wasn't memorable. Would have given another star but the service was awful. Painfully slow for everything. Had to wait 10+ minutes just to get a knife for the steak, and good luck if you want more water or to order a second drink.

eMJidzOTtWOUL2eBRJkyow.text: I'm so glad my colleagues and I chose to eat here during our short time in the city! I got the salmon entree, I substituted brussel sprouts for the beets on the side and they were delicious. I also had the 204 Smash cocktail which I really enjoyed. Service was average and the atmosphere was nice, I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Charlotte!

5iUR6qIuOSyeGmBjxXAjuw.text: We had a wonderful dinner here!! MJ and Whitney were kind, provided great service and made us feel right at home. Food was outstanding. Be sure to try the deviled eggs and pork chop!! Highly recommend!!

8hiDfZLnYRQHuXQs10PozQ.text: My wife and I were looking for a nice place last week to celebrate our first wedding anniversary without breaking the bank and stumbled upon 204 North! I would classify 204 North as casual fine dining. Upscale and fantastic food offerings without having to get extremely dressed up.  I cannot say enough good things about 204 North. Their cocktail list had the "usual" offerings and several drinks with a local twist. I had the "Southern Sipper", which consists of bourbon, Cheerwine, and brandied cherries. Definitely a great idea.  Best discovery of the night was that they have a Sunday Supper Club! Three courses for $35, can't afford not to. I had the Caesar Salad, 6-oz. filet, and we split the two dessert options. The caesar salad was HUGE! I probably could have eaten that as a meal in itself. The filet was amazing. Tender, juicy, cooked to perfection. The filet is served with mashed potatoes and vegetables. I had some of the mashed potatoes, but did not get in to the vegetables too much as I wanted to save room for dessert! The desserts were a salted caramel brownie with a scoop of ice cream and rice pudding. The brownie was fantastic - thick and rich, obviously paired very well with the ice cream. I was not a huge fan of the rice pudding, but it was not awful, just a weird contrast with the brownie I guess.   Our server Leon was phenomenal. If there was Yelp! for servers, he would get five stars as well. He said he was new to Charlotte and 204 North, but he had all the answers to our questions - very kind and very professional. When we return to 204 North, I would definitely ask if he's working and if we could be in his section!

qN6tLiyuvFi4jeVtjxmI9g.text: Great spot for lunch Uptown Charlotte. However, the place gets packed, so I always find it useful to book a reservation via OpenTable (yes for lunch, plus you get points for OpenTable). Their fries are fresh cut #win and their burgers are delicious. My friend said the Nashville chicken sliders are really good too. I also tried the tacos and the pork belly tacos are spot on. Been here several times for lunch and will definitely be back. Also, 1st time check in comes with a Yelp offer #win. While I usually eat the same thing, looking forward to trying more of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunchtime burger and fries. Deliciousness :)

Q4I92RNRywmH8v9WDeCMiw.text: This was my first time here, we sat at our table for about 15 minutes before being greeted by a server. The food took forever and was not good. The only thing I enjoyed were the deviled eggs with fried oyster. Entrees are over priced for what you get, I will not be returning back.

E5---Rw2sXpqMc88ENF9Vw.text: It's was dead inside, but it was on a Thursday night. The shrimp and grits were cold. The burger was tasty even though it was a tad burnt. I love fries but there were no Parmesan anywhere near these. Maybe this place would be better on the weekend, it has potential.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

L4a5rrVqu__VRpCEscCDOg.text: My boodle and I went to 204 North last night to celebrate our very first wedding anniversary, and I could not imagine going anywhere else to celebrate. Last night was our first time at 204 North.  Cocktails - YUM! I ordered the "Call Me Maybe," a tequila, berry, jalapeno beverage. It was delicious, with a kick, and pretty unique. Would definitely order again.  Food - I ordered off the Supper Club menu, which includes a salad, entree, and dessert for $35. This is a really great deal, and every part of it was delicious. The wedge salad comes with chunky blue cheese dressing. I ordered the 6 oz fliet. It was cooked to perfection and full of flavor. It came with mashed potatoes that were fresh and smeared across the plate.  The presentation was phenomenal. There were also carrots and root veggies that came with that, both seasoned well and tasty. For dessert, I did the rice pudding. This is a little different that I was expecting. It was a creamy, rice-y consistency that was sweet with a hint of lemon. The flavor was amazing.   Parking - It's Uptown Charlotte, so you can make your own assumptions about parking...  Service - Leon was our server and he was great! If I go back, I hope to see Leon again. He was incredibly attentive without being overbearing, and he was enjoyable to chat with. Thanks Leon for being awesome!  Atmosphere - 204 North is well decorated. It's trendy, but it can be a "dress up" and a "dress down" place at the same time. Their menu offerings definitely suggest it's fancier, but the atmosphere suggests it can be casual. Love that about this place.

m0VyN2ROVRdo8_v4P6j_yw.text: In the epic words of King Arthur in Monty Python -"you make me sad". This was probably the most lackluster brunch I've had in years, as in, we didn't even finish eating. I'm not saying any of this to be cruel, mean, or spiteful at all, but aim to be as honest and as helpful as possible. This was legitimately terrible. 204 North Kitchen and Cocktails does indeed have a lovely hipster vibe/decor going on that is accompanied by frequent heavy country music, which is very odd. My sister and I walked in to find only around 6 customers present, which is worrying on a Saturday at brunch time. But we always try to give restaurants a fair shot.   We really wanted to try this place as it had pretty good reviews(although it stumps me as to why). The service was polite and quick but when the food came out, it started sliding downhill very quick. I ordered the Summertime Pancakes which comes with peach preserves, blackberries, toasted meringue. As for the side, I ordered scrambled eggs. What I received instead was probably the most disappointing flapjacks in all of pancakedom. Those things were so dense, due to over mixture of the batter, they could've probably been used as body armor.  They were in such desperate need of leavening, vanilla, maybe some cinnamon and nutmeg that they probably could've pleased the most persnickety of bland food eaters. In addition, I never received any preserve fruit topping(it was only after I pointed this out that the waitress brought me fresh strawberries and blueberries, which is nice and all but isn't what it's supposed to actually come with it), and as you can see in the picture, the tiniest topping of meringue ever. May I also point out that scrambled eggs are NOT supposed to be brown! They were completely inedible. Moving on to my sister's Avocado Skillet. Anything that has the word "Skillet" in it usually comes out hot and bubbly yes? It was COLD, the asparagus was chopped far too fine, and the sauce could have used some seasoning and cooking as it tasted exactly like canned tomato sauce. Which is fine, but my god people! At least try to put some effort into it.  Note: This is not a rant by any means, but it needs to be said because this place is in desperate need of gastronomical help.   Let's recap shall we? It takes some actual effort to screw up something as simple as pancakes, scrambled eggs, and delivering something that is supposed to be extremely hot.   Do you hate your own cuisine? Because the lack of care, respect, and love when I tasted your food was tangible and stood out like a sore thumb. This, ladies and gentlemen, is why most restaurants go under. You may have the best location, the best decor, the best service, and STILL fail all because you neglect to transfer any of the positive emotions mentioned above to your food.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ummm...from my experience, I don&#39;t think eggs should be that color.
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Saddest pancakes evah!

3Utk5BJd3vaBoCBASvm_lw.text: Fantastic craft cocktail bar that offers a great variety of reasonably priced, delicious cocktails.  Bartenders can be better or worse depending on when you go.   The tacos are fantastic ($2 on Tuesdays and $3/10 every other day as a lunch special that comes with a side!). Definitely a must go.

p36-b9bQsy_TVNI2tsgBIg.text: 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails is in a word... FABULOUS!! Atmosphere is beautiful and cozy with exposed brick walls, dark wood flooring and furniture,  mood setting flameless candles. Then our brilliant food and wine came to our table by the absolutely adorable Orlando!! Orlando is by far one of the best waiters in uptown Charlotte- at such a young age, he's mastered the art of front-of-the-house hospitality.   We started with the meatballs on a bed of rosemary polenta which was out of sight!! Because we were not terribly hungry and getting ready to head across the street to see Hamilton,  we ordered light... soup of the day, the wedge salad and parmesan fries, along with a beautiful 2015 red blend from Klinker Brick. Everything was so delicious and served by the efficient and ever friendly Orlando!  We will absolutely be back and tell everyone we know about this fantastic find in Uptown Charlotte!!!

pwd0yTbYi8m5Oz9YXivRzw.text: I was here for a rehearsal dinner. I know sometimes it's tough to pull off a rehearsal dinner. Some of my food was a little cold but that's ok because the flank steak was delicious and the fried green tomatoes were awesome. My fiance had the shrimp and grits which was incredible. Our dinner limited us to some beer and wines so I would be curious about the cocktails. But seeing as how I will probably never be to Charlotte again in my life I'll just have to wonder for the rest of all time. They do have a great local selections as it seems that Charlotte is the craft brewery capital of the world or something by the amount of breweries opening here. The desert was awesome. I had pumpkin cheesecake, my fiance hates pumpkin and loved it. Also as a side note the upstairs bar looked like the place to hang and meet people if you in your mid to late twenties and wearing business casual.

Xl9KIKwp4MOl9yT59S_67A.text: On a recent visit we stopped in for an early lunch at 204... I will say I love the ambiance, the style and concept are great.. however the bathrooms were gross and the toilet didn't flush!! However the food was delicious, I got the hot chicken sliders and fries, super tasty lil bites! Only downside.. the drinks were overpriced and a lil too involved for my taste. I prefer 4 ingredients or less. But I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

A1oM7lrvIefRE0y4JCPJuQ.text: I attended a Bridal Shower on the 2nd level! The host ordered bottomless mimosas for the entire party and we had a brunch bar.  We had two waitresses and they were amazing and kind! I love the design of this place! I had been once before for a birthday dinner but it was open to others which was no problem at all! The food was amazing and the set up was very elegant! I would definitely recommend this for other events or a regular night out!

5W_8_3_0kvBCPHzCkK7fBg.text: I've only been once, but it was a really good experience.  I got the salmon with beets and mashed potatoes and loved it! I'm a big fan of beets but I'm really particular in how they are cooked. These were roasted and I think they had a sweet glaze to them; the consistency was just right. The mashed potatoes were great, but what isn't great if you had truffle oil to it? The salmon was good, too, but the sides really made the dish for me.   My husband ordered the flat iron steak. It comes with a side of carrots and turnips, which he said he would've preferred to have been cooked a little longer. I liked them, though. They weren't raw by any means but definitely had a crunch to them.   We shared an order of devil egg appetizers. If you try nothing else at this place, try those. They are topped with fried oysters which gives them such a nice flavor and texture. In our case, our server forgot to put the order in, so they comp'ed them for us. He was upfront about it and I almost told him to just cancel, since we got our entrees first. He convinced us to try them anyway and I'm so glad he did.  The service and vibe are nice. Everyone was very friendly. And aside from the mishap with the delayed appetizer, which worked out in our favor in the end and was clearly an honest mistake, it was fast. I like the design and layout of the place. It did a good job of feeling upscale-casual -- not snobby at all but feels nice enough for a date night, girls' night out, or even a work lunch.  I hope to go back soon to see if the service and food are consistent. I've seen a few negative reviews but so many factors can contribute to a one-time bad experience; I'm hoping those bad experiences are the exception and not the rule. I'd love to have a new 'go-to' restaurant uptown for when we catch a show at Belk Theater (that's why we were there) and so far this seems like a good fit.

x8IFMMR-0EucIkFpCR9_jQ.text: I made the mistake of coming to the restaurant during RESTAURANT WEEK. I can understand the staff possibly being tired, and having had a long day. But some of the things I experienced during dining here was unacceptable. I made the reservation for 8:45pm (because thats the most reasonable time they had available). We started our meal with calamari and spicy garlic shrimp. The shrimp were great, but the calamari was poorly prepared and extra chewy. Almost like they had been refried.... it was super greasy... I wouldn't have served it. When it was time to order dinner I chose the 3 course RW option.. starting with a Caesar salad, which was wilted when it arrived. I attempted to order the Flat Iron steak option... they were out of it (like many of the other things I tried to order) but the server informed me that they would be preparing filets in place of the Flat Iron steak.. with the same set up. I ordered that. I attempted to order a glass of red wine with my meal, and they were out of the first 2 things I attempted to order. I had to settle for a Zinfandel. My steak (which was cooked okay) came out with none of the things listed on the descriptor! I got a plain filet with cold mashed potatoes and cold broccoli! No chimichurri in sight. This was supposed to be my friends birthday dinner... so I had plans of ordering dessert in ADDITION to the Turtle Cheesecake I was supposed to be getting (per my 3 course option). I pulled our server to the side asking about birthday options. He assured me he would do something nice (and told me it would be free). He brought 4 mini desserts to the table. A bowl of MELTED ice cream (As in.. completely melted.. not just a little melted), a brownie with semi-melted ice cream on top, a hard sticky bun, and a decent carrot cake. WHO BRINGS COMPLETELY MELTED ICE CREAM TO A TABLE?! Not to mention he only brought 2 forks... there was 4 of us at the table. He told us he would be right back with 2 extra forks (which he didn't bring until he brought the damn bill) Notice the 4 desserts I listed? Yeah... no cheesecake. When I inquired about the cheesecake I was supposed to be receiving... he said "oh ma'am sorry I forgot to tell you we were out of the cheesecake!) WHY SHOULD I HAVE TO ASK YOU ABOUT MY DESSERT I WAS SUPPOSED TO GET ONLY TO BE TOLD YOU'RE OUT OF IT. YOU WEREN'T EVEN GOING TO SAY ANYTHING UNTIL I ASKED. Not to mention he charged me for my dessert! The lapses in service are  inexcusable.  We won't be back.

c1d-E6uhzwYsPFF7cBtDWg.text: Eh.. I think they are trying too hard. The location sells it's self, the cocktails were over done as well as the menu. Trying to be too trendy.. had a drink and shared an appetizer and then went elsewhere for the main course as nothing seemed "special" on the menu. Have heard weekend brunch is nice so might give that a try

wEdCyxbD9JZaKxX321tRZA.text: This place is a gem. We went for a girl's night out to celebrate a milestone birthday. Great cocktails, but they also have a decent selection of wine and beer. Everyone at the table raved about their meal. I had the Buffalo mac and cheese and side of roasted brussel sprouts. Simply amazing! It was so good I ate leftovers for breakfast this morning! We were put at a table in the window by the door. It could have gotten cold with people coming in and out, but they made sure to have a portable heater ready to go when we got there. Overall it was a terrific experience and I can't wait to go back with my husband for a date night.

3S-Y_vksES1-0M6G0VEiQg.text: Went here for brunch on Sunday. Coffee was good. Food took forever. Ordered poached eggs which came soft boiled and tasting like vinegar. Grits were yummy. Sausage patties looked and tasted like something from the grocery store. Fruit cup was mostly melon. They should focus on the quality of their food as much as they do their image.

w8sSpR_93QnACDR8gz-SOw.text: Trendy atmosphere, good food and we really enjoyed the custom cocktails BUT the service leaves so much to be desired. It took so long for our waiter to bring our drinks that we want to the bar and got them ourselves (we saw the bartender make them and the they sat there for over 10 minutes). Server would disappear for 20 minutes at a time and really put a damper on what could have been a great dining experience.

M_q9Bwkyuv515fXIwZWsUA.text: Had dinner on Sunday night here and the beet salad was tasty! Even more delightful was the salmon I added to the beet salad.The Brussels sprouts are definitely addictive so I had to combine myself not to return the following day!

tc9JQ3J6vyyp71yLIs-LKQ.text: Drinks and appetizers are amazing! The upstairs bar is a great, casual hangout. Ask the bartender for drink recommendations!

YSYSNTAs3rhJggosIfJ8Pg.text: Like others have said, went for dinner & drinks...should've kept it to just drinks.  The drinks were great. No argument there at all. The fried green tomatoes tasted "meh", but more memorably, they came out looking like cafeteria food. Horrible presentation...laughable really.   We both ordered burgers. The kicker was that we had to ask the manager if we could place an order. Our waitress just didn't seem to have any sort of grasp on timing. We also had to ask for our check at the end of the meal...after our table had been cleared and drinks finished. She came by and "checked on us" but seemed totally caught off guard when we requested the bill, like it never even occurred to her that we'd be ready to go.  Lastly was this weird light thing. Periodically thru the meal, there was this random strobe light above us that would flash. Thankfully no one had a seizure.  Will go back for drinks, but that's it.

cKIvpVIqBnVy3UzpsuzRVg.text: Food was very below average and drinks were ok. Service was decent. Overall I was disappointed.

SAEPNh5dahph7IhP2dbAJg.text: Well, that was disappointing   I've been watching as 204 was built and finally got in business. It's a beautiful space with warm wood and industrial accents, but what it looks like doesn't pay to keep the lights on. My wife and I got there today just at opening. We were first if the day. That should be good, right? Fast service, fresh food, etc. But none of that happened. The service was ludicrously slow, taking a very long time to actually be greeted by our waiter. Drink orders in and we waited another very long time to get them. Our waiter told slush that the unsweetened tea had not been made yet but he got it started. We ordered lunch. She, a chicken Cesar salad. Myself, the trio of tacos with a side kale salad with white balsamic vinegarette. Another long time later we got our food. The Caesar salad was "okay" but the chicken is sick very small and the flavor was generally absent. The tacos were a mess. Though a pretty mess. I am under the impression (I am a food service professional so my impressions are from a place of knowledge) that I got last night's meats. After such an extended period of time between ordering and service, I would have expected the meats to be very hot, they were at best tepid. The steak was tepid and kinda tough, the chicken was tepid and the same as the meat on the salad, and the pork belly (which I was SO looking forward to) was tepid and somewhat dry. No delightful fat pockets that pork belly is known for. No super smoky flavor. Just there. As we almost finished lunch we got our unsweetened tea. Told by our waiter that he had spilled the tea he had made and this batch was just now done. Thankfully they did charge us for tea or I would have had a fit. Finally, the white balsamic vinegarette had no flavor at all! I scooped out what I could of my wife's extra Caesar dressing to help.  And, considering the waiter seemed to be the only service guy until the bartender finally hopped out to help.on the floor, our change took a ridiculous time to get back. This was a not-good-at-all trip. Sad.

4AaXOLVMMhNjQMlkMvi0sw.text: Love this place! Have visited for dinner several times and hosted a private corporate event. Cute atmosphere with a beautiful private space upstairs. Kristen and Tori on the event staff are amazing! Very friendly and eager to help. Drinks and food are delicious. The General Manager, Brandon is awesome and very passionate about his restaurant. Highly recommend.

u3eSJyVejLd4RoK4y8LmfA.text: I've been to 204 many times since they've opened. For just drinks, dinner, and brunch. Hand down the best brunch in Charlotte. 10/10 would recommend!

G1QSqyqelBs2q_3uTgRkXg.text: Went in for dinner tonight for dinner with a girlfriend. We started with the tuna tartare and deviled eggs. Blown away is an understatement. The chicken entree was cooked perfectly. Our waiter, Smiley, was so kind and had a wonderful understanding of the menu! Highly recommended for a night out in uptown!

0fOYd6dUjzQ3AbYUpbiY-A.text: The food is blah and the service was horrible. We waited over an hour and a half for our food and it was cold when it came out. I would never suggest this restaurant to anyone. The only reason they're getting one star is because the drinks were decent...and well Yelp won't allow me to leave less than one star. Definitely not worth the hype!

e5atbf5cI75XZzoaLZ1gJg.text: The shrimp sandwich and fries where good. Great atmosphere. what I would expect eating at a restaurant in the queens.

1ig7w7VHtUzp2Y1YkDzjpA.text: Stopped here for lunch and enjoyed the chicken and shrimp tacos along with the parmesan fries. The drinks were good and the service was pretty decent as well.

OvwQdm1fWP6fyQQJR-yNfw.text: Great dinner last night. Hostess and servers were attentive and very friendly. Tuna tartare and salmon were delicious. Some cool cocktails too. Definitely returning soon.

wI_8NQGh4x461RYpFjrWKg.text: The meatloaf and the wedge salad was decent. The vegetable pasta was disgusting. Not sure what's keeping that on the menu

SNNqHLZ8Svvt-WeewSoDHg.text: I've only been for brunch, I wasn't throughly impressed because to me the prices didn't line up with quality/taste. The food wasn't bad, just uninspired. Lacked a lot of flavor. My eggs came out cold, though they did replace them it took a while to get them out. The fruit was fresh. They had great game day beverage options though, and that I could appreciate. The service was also decent. Just wish they'd work on the food a little bit.

PTCW1ujYCT14rVxKyMEm0Q.text: Excellent choice for a Tuesday! Taco Tuesday 2$ each and I tried three different tacos they were all exceptional. Paul was our server and he was nothing short of being great. We had a few drinks and had a great selection to choose from. I would definitely recommend anyone to try this place out. Great atmosphere and good service, great selection!

3MyVPL9j-ZDrmyRVIKPHeA.text: We made a reservation for a Saturday night; not sure we needed it (it didn't seem like they were on a wait) but we were seated right away either way.  Service was great and we really enjoyed the cocktails and food.  Nothing pretentious, but was great for a date night and we thought the service was superb.  Would definitely recommend.

UbGs9a4h2DZLIdsqTBgPEQ.text: We went for brunch. Get the avocado toast it was delicious. The burger was okay a little greasy and salty but overall solid. The salmon burger was a unique option for brunch. The grits were really good. Bloodys were good also.

Zx4gmYO6F3HkC0HQffOMvg.text: Staff was extremely nice, but not very attentive.  We ordered the Ballantyne specialty cocktail, which was absolutely delicious, as were the shrimp and grits.  The other items we ordered were very "meh."  The calamari (and yes, we knew it wasn't fried, but wanted to try it anyway.)  The sauce and accompanying potatoes were flavorful, and I would order that as a side alone.  The calamari itself was very bland and added nothing to the dish.  We also ordered the spring pea ravioli, and it was disappointing as well.  Nothing to pinpoint as awful, just not very good, and certainly would not recommend or order again.  As a carb lover, I appreciate a restaurant who brings a basket of homemade bread, but in this case, I'd rather save the calories.    TLDR: go for the cocktails, and then somewhere else for dinner.

HDhWWZPThdKvgLKlLwCtHA.text: This place is cool with pretty interesting twist on traditional dishes. The cocktail selection is good and food is tasty. Cute atmosphere and deff will be back with friends.

VDT1htNCS8Lr6WyuLdr1rg.text: This place has great decor and great music. I asked the bartender to make me a Sunday walk in the park . I was not sure if he was going to make it right but he did an amazing job! It was delish. He was nice ,attentive and not annoying. The reason I did not give 5 stars was because I ordered the avacado toast and it was not at all what I expected. I usually order this at anyplace I go to for brunch. It was no where near as good as the drink. It is literal 2 pieces of wheat bread, and spread. I ordered it without egg. I'll get some thing next time. My bartender Andrew was awesome!

0kTexTAhFQEGxCGrW9pEeg.text: Great environment , cocktails and food!  Ordered the Quinoa risotto which is a good meatless option!

QzLYRXwwk80g_CAMIrHjbg.text: Beautiful design and laid back setting.  We started off with the Fried Green tomatoes.  They were really good and the side of pimento cheese and chow chow was a nice combination.    We ordered the meatloaf and pimento cheese ravioli for entrees, but they were out of both.  I will give them a pass...hopefully it's because both are really good.  Our backups were the seared Steak and Lobster Mac n Cheese.  Both were good, but didn't blow us away.  The Mac N Cheese comes with a delicious corn side..my only complaint is that there wasn't more of it.      The desert was by far the best part!  Their warm sticky bun with butterscotch ice cream is worth the trip itself!

65XZEtyCvo4-Z2JsD2rArg.text: What a great addition to uptown Charlotte.  Popped in here for a quick mid-day bite to eat and to finally check this place out.  We were greeted by all smiles and sat at the bar for easy access and instant service.  I tried the deviled eggs (with a twist because of a mini fried oyster atop it) and the smoke chicken wings.  Both really well done and both hit the spot to tame my hunger.  In addition they had a bloody mary bar and a great selection of cocktails alongside draft and bottle beer selections to surely satisfy.  The interior is warm and cozy and trending along with other new locations by way of the use of tufted leather seating, wood and steel elements.

ajzSC8RMbqQ8F1sb9iJcMQ.text: Gah. Shame on me. Came here once before and got a few drinks, pork belly appetizer, and dessert. The drinks were overpriced, appetizer wasn't very good and was a tiny portion, and dessert wasn't memorable. The only thing memorable was a gigantic cockroach crawling up the wall next to us. The server ended up taking care of our bill so we left a nice tip and thought we'll try it again after it's been up and running awhile. Came here for Queens Feast on a Tuesday night. They still have a condensation problem on the pipes because I kept getting dripped on the entire night. The service was super slow. We were there for 2 hours and 45 minutes... I got the fried green tomatoes which were surprisingly good. Also got the salmon which was under salted but the other 2 people that got the salmon thought it was over salted so maybe they salted theirs instead of mine? Ordered the sticky buns but by the time they brought out dessert they had run out so I got the peach shortcake which was really dry and didn't have enough cream to compensate. Also they had balsamic dots to plate which I thought was chocolate. The balsamic decor did not go well at all with the shortcake. Overall food and service was underwhelming.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Queens Feast 2016

3jWwMOO1Vuvcxbev2r8krA.text: I'm sitting in the restaurant pondering what all I must say. This restaurant needs some tips that's for sure. The bread was hard as bricks and burnt. I looked around and I felt like this place is upscale. You don't bring out burnt bricks. On to the food, I ordered the NC organic chicken served with a teaspoon size of potato puree, extremely hard turnip roots, a carrot slither, and two mustard jus. The veggies were so hard that I couldnt eat them. The chicken was seasoned to perfection and moist. The veggies could have been great if I could chew them. Hard as rocks! I paid $22 plus tax for chicken and the teaspoon of potato puree. My friend ordered a burger that came with fries. I took the fries too eat with my meal. The water wasn't filtered and tasted like dirt smells. I rarely EVER write a two or one star review. Overall, the restaurant can be great or even fabulous by making corrections on the above problems. The inside is very pretty and right now I feel is it only good for getting drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

WO3ZjOGlaf7_espv9qTvpw.text: I was in uptown on business this past week. One of my colleagues recommended this spot and spoke very highly about the cocktails.  So I headed there on Thursday night around 7pm. It was quite lively and I grabbed the last seat at the bar. The cocktail menu was quite impressive. Cocktails (aka libations according to the cool kids) were named after the various neighborhoods and suburbs in the Charlotte area. I had the Dilworth...quite refreshing gin drink. Then I ordered a small portion of the kale salad and smoked pork belly.   While I was waiting for my food, the server, Molly, brought me some fresh made bread with this amazing fruit butter. Not that I needed all those carbs but I finished it all. The pork belly arrived; it was so delicious and I consumed it quickly. The kale salad was too salty and I could not eat more than two bites. I told Molly that I was not able to eat it. She was so gracious and took it off my check which I really appreciated it.   Would love to come back on my next visit to uptown and try some more cocktails and food here!

ssvqx8vhas_zUV0FOnHFaQ.text: We held my son's rehearsal dinner for 60, with a welcome reception of drinks for 30 more at 204 North Kitchen.  We had the entire upstairs to ourselves for the entire evening.  Tori was fantastic, responsive and answered most emails within a day.  She helped with menu suggestions, seating arrangements, and accepting flowers from the vendor.  She helped design and print personalized drink menus with creative drink names.  Stafford assisted with the day of the event, moving tables, getting candles for tables and coordinating staff.  There were plenty of bar tenders and wait staff to keep the buffet dishes filled, the drinks flowing and the dishes cleared. The atmosphere was casual but classy, and encouraged guests to mingle.  They even personalized the chalk boards for our event! Our guests loved the food, especially the meatloaf, shrimp and grits, Nashville chicken and brussel sprouts. I can't praise this venue and this staff enough.  I highly recommend it for your next event.

5kQxRt9j-YmciQbvNdKiIg.text: I was lucky enough to be able to attend a soft opening for 204 North and I was impressed from start to finish. The interior is beautifully decorated and I could tell how much thought went into the design. The owner even put ample purse hooks throughout the bar and on some of the tables - awesome!  Every cocktail I tried was delicious. I had the bartender make me a drink based on my preferences and I would definitely order it again if it was on the menu. The Ballantyne was another personal favorite of mine and is sure to be a big seller.  Again, it was obvious that 204 dedicated a lot of time to the small touches that make an experience great. Right off the bat, we were given housemade ciabatta with a spicy olive oil dipping sauce. Sooo good. My favorite appetizer was the fried green tomatoes and housemade pimento cheese. The pimento really added to the dish and I love that they made it in house. All of of the entrees I sampled were delicious but I was really impressed by the chicken. It's so easy to mess chicken up but this dish was incredibly moist and flavorful. For dessert I tried the sticky bun. I was told that the restaurant has a pastry chef from Scotland so I look forward to trying more of his creations! 204 is a much needed addition to the area and I look forward to going back.

mIMxMRvCEZRPR5jtAFoRww.text: Rarely do I give a 5 star review but I definitely had to for this restaurant. I'm not sure if it was the time of day or or it's just how the restaurant runs on the regular, however I was VERY pleased with the service my mother and I received yesterday (2.17.18) when we went to this spot. We arrived around 2 p.m. The restaurant wasn't super busy however they did have a large party and a few other tables to serve. Initially when we walked in I was a little irritable because NO ONE acknowledged us, not even the servers or bartenders as we waited at the hostess stand. However, after a minute or two the hostess finally arrived back at the stand and took us to our table. Everything after that was perfect. Our server Mike was outstanding. He had the best smile and he kept checking on us (but not in an annoying way). Appetizers and food came out speedy, fresh and hot! Our drinks were outstanding! They were so fresh and had plenty of alcohol. I think prices are super reasonable and the atmosphere is so cute and cozy. Between my mom and I the bill was 106 and I left a 20% tip. We had 5 cocktails between us, two appetizers and two entrees. I will DEFINITELY be back. My only recommendation to this restaurant would be to make sure guests are greeted upon arrival.

UwtO-OCC9nG_P_KKm45--g.text: We arrived about 12:45pm on a Sunday, were seated quickly,  but then the wait began. We sat for 15 minutes while the manager and hostess had a pow wow right by our table. Finally, a waitress asked if we had been waited on. Her name was Gina and she did an amazing job taking care of us. We both had the 204 Omelet, no flavor, barely any cheese, very disappointing. The table next to us had the same issues so it seems this place seats tables but fails to let the waitresses know.

qTRlBA1JSxaSK-BUvwpmGw.text: The 3.5 stars on Yelp is right on target. We decided to try it none the less.  We ordered an array of appetizers. The fried green tomatoes were really good. Calamari was extra chewy. The wedge salad was swimming in dressing. The oyster topped deviled eggs were not good. The oyster was overcooked and the deviled egg filling had absolutely no flavor. I was really excited about these but they were a let down.  You aren't going to have a terrible meal here but it's not going to be a good meal either.

3I9Iw0wygr-LC5oMXjVwKg.text: We came with a birthday party of 11 and we got to the restaurant at the reserved time of 8:15. We were sat right away and ordered drinks which did not come until 15 min later (water took 30 min!!! IT'S WATER!!!!). We then had to wait almost an hour to order our food because our waiter did not come over to our table at all but went to every other table around us. When we finally ordered it took us 1 1/2 hours to get our food which then came out cold. Not luke warm...COLD. We had to send a few things back and didn't even bother with the rest because the wait staff was obviously annoyed with us. The Mac and cheese may look good on photos but beware. They make a large amount of it and it just sits under a heater all day so it is dry, crunchy, and not good at all. To be honest the food and service were less than mediocre and I will not be coming back. STAY AWAY!!

yP8BFH-K8NDiZL-m0GTEDA.text: Only thing better than the service was the food. Cocktails fantastic, fried green tomatoes appetizer was the best, entree was delicious and desert no words how good.

ErQv1xs2YkHuaitgUAKr4g.text: We slipped in right before the kitchen was about to shut down and the servers were really gracious about it. Food came out hot, fresh, and as-ordered. Chicken sliders and The Banker cocktail hit the spot. The pork belly was fun too. Plus, they were playing Seattle music. Bonus!

zrna5WFpX6IyNRx2dxQ5dw.text: Positives: good (not great) bourbon cocktail shorted in the glass; nice, affordable wine list but not enough selections by the glass; great flavor on pork belly appetizer; creative but limited menu for what is essentially a two-story bar. Negatives: ambiance is a hot mess --- loud pop music overhead, faint odor of stale beer, uncomfortable metal chairs, cloth napkins but one fork & knife for entire meal; server pleasant but young & inexperienced; no menu specials. 204 North hasn't made up its mind whether its a bar with pretty good food or a restaurant with a trendy bar scene. Like the cocktail vibe, but that suggests a more sophisticated crowd that demands a classier dining experience than they currently deliver. It's almost as if the GM and the chef are not on the same page about what pays the bills. If they want to be great (one way or the other), someone needs to take the lead.

63xVDB03w_dD49_7UTvY3A.text: We visited on Saturday for the first time. The restaurant is beautiful! We were blown away by how nice the design was. It has an industrial modern feel. We went early afternoon so it was not busy at all but we enjoyed it as service was great and our food came out quickly.   We ordered the hot chicken sliders and they were fantastic! I was very impressed. We sat at the bar and the service was great.  We will visit again for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

Tq-jDgNT9R2sd9IHTnOTfg.text: I had the pleasure of attending a yelp event at 204 North Kitchen and I must say I was quite surprised by the abidance of 204 North! The first level was lit with just the right amount of lights to make it a comfortable setting for a romantic date or just dinning with some friends.  The upstairs was a little more open as it was transformed to accommodate a large crowd of people (aka Yelp Elites)!  There was a nice big fully stocked bar and the Elites had their choice of two signature cocktails! Also available for the Elites was a nice array of cheese, crackers & Lavish spreads; On other tables was a grilled cauliflower & chick peas dish, delicious deviled eggs and a few other dishes to delight our pallets!    The Elites showed up strong with unwrapped toys for the toy drive.  I'm looking forward to my next trip to 204 North Kitchen.

m1TsCPLbTDN0Du5dpvIX0Q.text: This is my third time at 204 but my first time that I felt inclined to write a review! Service and food matched up. I've been before and thought one or the other were good but not great. This time our waiter was engaging, helpful and fun! The food and drinks were quick to the table, despite a nice steady crowd. Everyone loved what they had as well. My substitution for hot chicken with the chicken and waffles was an excellent choice but they really should call it fire chicken lol. Still was juicy and good but owwweeeee!!

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and waffles
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deviled Eggs with fried oyster
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. $5 Bloody Mary

xqJPUuZ48VvghnKRuZ3fKg.text: This was honestly not a good experience.  From the moment we walked in we were not so politely greeted by the hostess who told us it would be a 30 minute wait but it ended up being no wait, which was great.  We were seated and told she would be right back with our menus.  It was at least 5-7 minutes later we had no water, had not been greeted and had no menu.  Finally the hostess brings us 3 menus even though we had a party of 4.  It was just all downhill from there...put it this way..we got our appetizer before our drinks.   The breakdown was like this: -we asked for water with lemons to start.  We had to ask for the lemons two more times before we got them -the meatballs we ordered were served cold and not on purpose -the duck fat potatoes were bland as could be -we were never given appetizer plates -we were served rose when ordered prosecco -when we inquired about our drinks by one of the guys running our food he said "I will get your server"...not a very lofty idea considering she is the one that was missing the mark -we were told the smores in a jar was great for sharing with 4 people yet it came with 4 small fractions of a Graham cracker and really was best suited for one person.  I could go on and on.  It was just a disheveled, unorganized hot mess of an operation.  I did enjoy the flavor of the meatballs and the tempura shrimp was good!  The Brussels salad sounded good but it was dry and had no flavor.  It was also very small.  I was just overall not impressed at all.  I think the atmosphere was lovely and the location is ideal!  They just have a lot of work to do to make it worth the price point and trouble of dining uptown.  I wouldn't return at this point.

uDjSn_fAVf_UYeS5JZ8kIA.text: I have eaten here and number of times and it's always been pretty good, tonight we took a friend who was in from New York and I will have to see it was very below par, I had the cheeseburger and fries, she had the Nashville hot chicken. It tasted like that the cheeseburger tasted like it was cooked two hours ago, I wasn't asked about temperature, my fries had obviously been laying around for a while as they were Luke warm The chicken also tasted like it was fried while ago maybe just reheated in the microwave as the coating was not crispy and soggy underneath All in all it's usually pretty good but tonight was very disappointing

X2o2kDXFJqW9eOjjW4Wu-w.text: My friend and I have been looking at this restaurant for a while. I even considered it as a venue for my bridal shower but we had already selected one. Today we had the pleasure of visiting and it was phenomenal. We really loved our waiter Orlando! He was very personable and he was spot on with his recommendations. He selected my two drinks Hashtag Basic and Ballantyne and they were amazing. I also ordered the Vanilla French Toast with Crispy Bacon! Ahhhh- Mazing! I will definitely return! Thanks Orlando!

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

8VtUskfObKBs5KOhVjw21g.text: I wish I knew the name of our waitress. She really made the whole experience. There were a few mistakes made with our orders but our waitress was so sweet and accommodating. She even took a drink off my tab for the inconvenience. I love the decor inside. I came here for brunch and would recommend the chicken and waffles!

mPAvkt3mkVvIiaLmNBUs4A.text: Where do I even begin. This place was terrible! Me and my boyfriend will NEVER be going back here. Both the service and the food were awful. Me and my boyfriend were having a date night and I was looking forward to going here all week. I had seen Charlotte Agenda post their Nashville Hot Chicken and knew I had to have it. When I got my food I was appalled. The chicken was so over fried! I was surprised the cook looked at that and thought it was acceptable to send out to a guest. It was like a hard shell around the chicken and was so overfried the top wasn't even touching the chicken inside. I couldn't even bite into it, I had to peel off the shell just to taste some of the chicken inside. The Mac and cheese that came with it looked and tasted like it was 3 days old that had been reheated 12 times. The best part of the meal were the pickles that came on top of the chicken.  Why didn't I send the food back you ask? Hmm... probably because our server was so MIA the whole time she never came up to us on her own. It took flagging down from my boyfriend to get her to come to us for water refills or a drink order. I didn't want to take 20 minutes to find her then another 20 for the food to be recooked. We just wanted to leave as soon as possible. She didn't even clear our table once so we had empty glasses and the empty appetizer on the table with our food and new drinks, half of it was close to falling off if we weren't super careful. When we finally flagged her down again to get the check she got it back to us then stood and stared as us...it was so awkward. So my boy friend was like ohh and handed her the card. (Most servers walk away and give you a second to pull it out). When she brought the card back a couple minutes later she kept looking at us and rudely said you got your card back right? Trying to rush us to leave while I was trying to finish my drink. Anyways we left and had to finish getting cocktails and dessert at another restaurant because of the awful experience there.  My friend and her family were also at the restaurant the same night and she also complained to me after how bad their service was as well.   Pictures I'm attaching don't even do it justice how bad the food looked.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

lnFm9u71DoePCxttJgkVSw.text: I love the textures in this restaurant.   The bricks and woods and fixtures and pipes on the ceiling.  It is visually very intriguing.  For Sunday brunch, I had the hot chicken and grits.  The chicken was breaded and seemed fried and was served on top of a thick piece of bread with pickles on top.   The grits seemed like they had some cheese in them.   It was a fun meal and different from the norm.  We were seated at a high top table and had to sit on stools without backs.  My only complaint was that the stools were uncomfortable.  But, this place has a huge glitzy bar and we assume that much of their business comes from people popping in for drinks.  They probably use the bar stools just long enough to swallow a drink or two.  There were some regular tables in front of the restaurant.   Next time, I will ask to be seated there.  All in all, it was another uptown urban dining experience with a warehouse feel.  I am a definite fan!

Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

poqqCpPbOM6WhywCdH75xw.text: This is a really cute restaurant. I was so excited to come here! I had been waiting all week. We came for Easter brunch after church (as I imagine many people did) so we made sure to make a reservation just in case. We were promptly seated, ordered drinks, and ordered food all in about 10-15 minutes. Our server was very nice and helpful. We got "bubbles for the table" to drink, which in hindsight was a great choice because it was the only thing that kept us happy through the whole restaurant experience. For about the next 20 minutes, we waited on my friend's appetizer. She ordered deviled eggs with oysters on them. It wasn't necessarily bad, but there wasn't much flavor unfortunately. I was hoping that the restaurant would redeem itself once our brunch plates came out, but after a while we started seeing other people get their food around us. A little over an HOUR after we placed our orders, our food finally came out and it was warm, at best. My friend ordered the shrimp and grits, which was the most under-seasoned thing I've ever had, and I got the home fry skillet which would've been great if it was actually any temperature over mildly warm. If it's served in a skillet it should be hot. Not only did we wait an hour, it tasted like we got the leftovers.  The manager walked over to the table next to us and discounted their meal due to wait times (I'd say they waited about 20 minutes less than we did) and then came over and did the same for us - even though none of us asked. It was barely a discount for having spent two hours there for just two people to eat, but it was a nice gesture. The only reason this isn't a one star review is because the staff was so nice the entire time.   After spending more than two hours of our holiday there, we came home to change and try to enjoy what was left of our day even though my friend said she felt sick shortly after we left the restaurant. She has been throwing up for pretty much the entire afternoon, so safe to say our experience pretty much ruined our entire holiday plans. We unfortunately will not be returning.

gp6NSkNXOCvbPn-NlAtkAw.text: Went there for dinner with my fiance - the place was completely empty. In comes a family of four with two loud , small children- whom the hostess sat right beside us.  The mom kindly asked if they could have a different table since she didn't want to bother us. The stupid hostess said "no you're good here..."  Obviously not the family (and def not the kids) fault. But seriously. Wtf.  We paid for the drinks we just ordered and left- we won't go back.

soRllpnEmJRpkFhg3w2QXg.text: So I've been here a couple times for appetizers  and drinks and always had a good experience. The vibe is very cozy here and is welcomed to dress up or dress down. Recently I went here for a birthday brunch and the experience was as usual, great. We had a wonderful server, Orlando, that was great at accommodating a large table of indecisive girls while juggling other large graduation tables. The food itself was great. I opted for their cheeseburger and it did not disappoint. It was cooked perfect and juicy with yummy parmesan fries to compliment. I have yet to try dinner but I look forward to it!

r9YCYKzFaW3hF3sxbza8-w.text: I can here for Yelp Restaurant Week. I'm glad I made a reservation. This place gets pretty busy on week nights.   I started with a cocktail called Amazing Grace. It has spiced rum, strawberry, mango, peach, lime and black tea. I expected for it to be a little bit sweeter ( our waitress suggested it was one of the sweet options) but it wasn't. It had a nice flavor but I'd look forward to trying something else the next time.   Next, I tried the calamari. It was good, I really liked that it came with peppers! It's a nice start to the meal.  For dinner, I ordered the salmon. It comes with beets but you can sub for any of the other veggies. I opted for the roasted brussel sprouts. The salmon was cooked perfectly and delicious! The mashed potatoes with truffle oil were delicious too! The brussel sprouts were a bit of a disappointment. They were a bit too crispy and dry for me. I love them roasted but these didn't do it for me. I'd absolutely order this dish again, just select another side.   But overall, the service was good and the they have a great menu. I'm also looking forward to giving the brunch a try!

SsD7ZN9dbQSChyibBVOPPg.text: It was Yelp restaurant week so we decided to try this place. When we first arrived, we were sat at a high top small square table. I am petite so sitting on a bar stool for dinner does not work well for me, my feet dangle, (DON'T LAUGH) and I need a place for my purse. I asked to be moved to an actual table with regular chairs and the server was hesitant at first. There were several open tables  not sure if they had reservations to come in but she eventually moved us. For the app, we ordered the calamari. It had fried peppers in it too. be careful if you don't like spicy. Also the marinara to me tasted like tomato paste not marinara, I didn't use it.  For my main meal i ordered the salmon with mashed potatoes and regular corn. When I tell you this was so good. I wish it didn't end. I would order this again. I will say I wish they validated the parking. Parking in the garage is a a little weird to get to the restaurant when you park. It was impossible to get street parking. Other than that, no complaints. Give it a try!

RGmV76gt0Ta-AlCnjWxrvA.text: Great food and cocktails! Our server, Michael, was amazing. Ask to sit in his section and you won't be disappointed! New favorite spot!!!

Fo7x9LycgdNWn1R4I33vNA.text: Okay, but not great. I took my mom here for her birthday dinner and I expected more from this place.  The cocktails were pretty good,  but the food was very blah!  For appetizers we got the deviled eggs and calamari- both were not too bad.  The dinner however was just very bland and disappointing especially for the price! My mom and I both got the Nashville hot chicken and side of potato salad. The chicken needed a sauce or something to make it a little more interesting or flavorful, but I will say that the potato salad was good. The other people in our group got burgers and a salad and I don't think anybody was particularly impressed with their meal.   Just based on reading the descriptions on the menu the food sounds really good, which is why I I picked this restaurant, but 204 North failed to deliver. I may give this place a second chance in the future, but I don't know if I want to take a chance and spend that kind of money here again for another so-so meal.   Come for the cocktails and apps, but don't stay for the dinner.

rozCO_SA4LlK9hv8XRSBQw.text: We really enjoyed our meal here. The service was great.  It was a little noisy, but it seems to matter who you sit by.  There was a large party right next to us and once they left the noise level dropped substantially.  We had the hot chicken as an appetizer and then for entrees had the burger and also the salmon.  All was delicious, but to me the star of the dinner was the hot chicken sliders.....they have a hot chicken dinner, but the beauty of the chicken on a bun with a pickle is what you really want.  One order of the chicken appetizer comes with 4 sliders.  Next time we'd definitely order more than one order and I'd probably consider making this my me with another app or salad or something.  We liked this restaurant and will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot Chicken Sliders
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. 204 Cheeseburger and fries.  We asked for no cheese and they offered to put bacon and avocado on instead.  Very nice!!

8ZGJFoza_tx9qzk0LGIk3g.text: If all you want is a place that looks great, then 204 North fits the bill to a T. In fact, they go a bit farther by having a nice sounding menu as well - several, in fact you might even say many of the items on the menu are ones that you would like to order, and therein lies the problem.  We stopped by prior to a show at the Belk, so we were there for brunch. That may or may not change your results, but keep that in mind.  One of our orders was for a BEC (Bacon Egg and Cheese) on a bagel. One of the keys of this item is that it is offered on a plain or an everything bagel. I enjoy an everything bagel, and in fact do not particularly care for plain, because they are, well, plain, so I opted for the everything. I also found that the sides offered, at least at brunch, are not terribly exciting (sorry, I don't want a side bagel with my bagel), so I went with the fruit.  What was the fruit? According to the server, it was "seasonal". I have never seen a seasonal plant, tree or vine, but I decided I would give it a go.  When the order arrived, it was served... on a plain bagel. Now I have worked in a food service. Mistakes happen. Ingredients run out. Busy periods happen. Yet we were some of the first people there on the first day of brunch. And regardless of all of that, it's somewhat irrelevant, because the server neglected to mention that there was no everything bagel on the plate.  Now I could see that there wasn't one, but you would think that they would mention this, apologize for not having it, or something. Anything. Nope, just plopping it down. So I asked about it, only to be informed that they didn't have them anymore. The way it was phrased made it sound like the everything bagel was no longer an option, and I get that the server may not be a party to this, and it is definitely not their fault.  But still - most restaurants have a lovely list that tells servers what they should tell people is off the menu (temporarily or permanently). I don't know whose fault it is, but it's annoying. Even more so because it's not the only item - apparently they were also out of chicken salad. I probably wouldn't have ordered it, so it is nice that the server found out. I ended up getting a less-than-exciting biscuit and splitting the somewhat better chicken and waffle dish we already had, because we had somewhere to be.

fRDtYXaNDn0AgRBTQ-YArw.text: During CIAA, we were short on time and ravenous.  As walked past this restaurant and saw available tables, I didn't need another second to decide to go for it.  We were quickly seated (high top table with stools) and I discovered there was no place to put my purse, nor my coat.  The waiter came and hung up my coat (we passed it near the front) and I pulled out my handy purse hanger to hang it from the table.  We were in a hurry and quickly ordered.  I had a glass of the Stonecap cabernet and the Spicy Garlic Shrimp.  The spice level was above medium and delightful without burning my lips.  We also shared the Salted Caramel Brownie served with vanilla ice cream.  It was delicious.  Overall, this was a quick, convenience, and tasty option before a show.  I will definitely visit 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails again.    Note: They have a fully stocked bar!

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eclectic decor

16dANOBiw5kpIL8kX3WJhQ.text: What was hailed by the bartender as an awesome charcuterie board under-delivered in just about every way.  From the overall placement of the ingredients, to the tiny globs of meat, our tray suffered right out the gate.  First, our "board" was an aluminum tray with food placed directly on it (no liner).  My wife quipped "looks like something they'd slide through a prison door."  I could ramble on about the two mediocre cheese options, the scarcity of meat, the cheap crackers, the sprig of grapes with some way beyond ripe, the dab of pimento, a couple nuts, etc.    The bartender asked what we thought and was obviously flustered when we said,  "Meh, not so good."  He tried to make it up in small ways when billing us out,  which we appreciated, though unnecessary.   His kitchen let him down, and unfortunately, us,  too.  Shop around.

k0uN_ecMdksuigusi6ZK2A.text: Food was above average.  Atmosphere was good.  The overall service was terrible.  We were a party of 8 and  I showed up a few minutes later than some of my party and was never asked if I wanted a drink so I just drank water.  It took 1.5 hours from the time we ordered our entrees to get them and when they came out 5 came out together, 1 came out a few minutes later, and the last 2 came out 20 minutes after the 1st 5.  I'm not sure if they have dessert or not because our waitress never offered it to us, she just brought us our check.  Dinner was 2.5 hours long and most of it was spent waiting for our entrees.  I will not return based on the service.

mGV-4cTvJy3PWznIRRs6Dw.text: We went to 204 specifically for the cocktails. It's next to a busy club offers a more mature theme.   My girlfriend suggested we visit after a work outing. When we arrived we were welcomed and sat right at the bar. Charles was our bartender and he took good care of us. He helped us pick from among their selection of drinks and even had a few of his own concoctions.   He was very personable and knowledgeable. The bar has its own kitchen. I had a burger and we shared some pork belly. They have bar and high top seating.  The cocktails were delicious and are among the best in Charlotte. We will definitely return and sample more of their creative cocktails.

N6xoMkypUXG0sDGhR-oIPg.text: I am not hard to please.  This is the 2nd time I've been to 204 North. The first time was a week ago for lunch and although it was underwhelming (tacos fell apart, friend's salad had chicken on it that looked like it was chopped after being pulled out of a can, etc.), I gave them another chance.  I won't be returning.  Where to begin. The drinks were watered down on top of being overpriced. There were 20+ minute gaps where we'd order a new drink and wouldn't get anything back, sometimes not even a refill on the water either. The food was abysmal. We ordered the charcuterie and cheese plate, calamari, fried oysters, and sticky bun. Strangely, the sticky bun came out 5 minutes before everything else, and was so hard and cold that I could have thrown it through their window. When the other food items arrived, we didn't even have silverware or plates and had to ask for them when they rushed away without checking. Bizarre.   I have literally never asked for the manager in a restaurant, but had to when we got the check that included all of the food (over half of which was sent back). They came out and gave us the typical sob story about being understaffed that night and sometimes you just have a bad day, blah blah blah, but after reading other reviews of this place I think it must be pretty commonplace.   TL;DR version - do not go to 204 North.

0X22HSkDgbxpIwRcp4XHxw.text: Delicious entrees, American style but with a twist. They have great cocktails and brunch. If you like something sweet, order an Amazing Grace.

nxC4xZ8oRi0o94WXazYKLw.text: Passing through Charlotte and fortunate enough to be staying nearby. We dropped in without reservations and we're seated. The service is friendly and prompt. The food excellent and reasonably price cocktails.

CB-QLIPV9K6ibJeVu48HXw.text: Creative, delicious food and drinks. Friendly staff and a great atmosphere! A must go!

LHkqnao2x4wGIQSeK7vkSg.text: Terrible cocktail. Food marginal. No real health choices. Will not return. This was 2nd visit after same experience first time. Thought I'd give it another chance. Would never recommend this place.

sH_JneOctdr3xv-7Hh3QoA.text: I went this afternoon for lunch and it was simply amazing . From the tasty food to the great service provided by Orlando, this has been one of my best brunch experiences in Charlotte . Can't wait to go back to try the dinner menu!

_yUVsCnAXZkzh6ltB7UyvQ.text: Food was delicious. I got the Nashville hot chicken and it was great. The ambiance in the restaurant is beautiful. My only reason for 3 stars is that I was in a large group and the waiter accidentally charged my card twice. When I called the restaurant a manager was suppose to return my call and never did. I would still return to this establishment.

meCXBSegVytUtJCkpyp2Gw.text: Terrible service!. Went with a friend before the concert and waited at least 10 minutes before bartender spoke and then he walked away!

9iB7ahnnxq1y2WFJtRC3yA.text: My girlfriend and I were walking by there Tuesday, stopped in for a drink and it was taco Tuesday. What a pleasure. We've been trying to find a bomb taco shop here in town for a while now and haven't had much luck. And this isn't even a taco shop. Dude, this place is doing it right. Had the pork belly and the steak taco gf had the steak and the chx. They were all amazing. Honestly I'm from LA and she's from Vegas and honestly we've been let down here with the taco seen and we've tried, southbound, Babaloo, Bakersfield. But this place is a hidden gem.  Thank you.

gcs0WhPkRI-52ackF6JMSg.text: Food was good! Orlando was an amazing server!! Strong beer selection. Love the atmosphere and music.

W0Jeqms6WcRmlFDJZS9R5A.text: Wow.. amazed at the bad service I experienced today. Not sure they really wanted any business. Stopped in with my husband and daughter at 1:30 for brunch as it was a holiday. Several tables open and we were told since we didn't have a reservation we had to sit at the bar, which we did. Clearly bartender wasn't happy about serving us as my daughter and I had to use napkins to wipe our areas down (there were 3 other people at bar so she wasn't busy). My $4 cup of coffee was never refilled. My daughters sandwich was to come with out mayo which upon seeing it slathered on the sandwich when delivered we asked the waitress to return to get it corrected somewhere....we never saw her again or the bartender to even check on us until they delivered the check. We saw other people come in to eat and were turned away if they didn't have a reservation...meanwhile by the time we left 3/4 of restaurant was empty. Clearly understaffed..and staffed with people who didn't want to work.  Very disappointed in this establishment and will be letting anyone who asks me know.

6S5XoHZ1L2K-4UxGqtc-fQ.text: Save your money.  Server couldn't think of one dish that diners loved so strike number one.  We decided on sharing the deviled eggs & spinach salad (eggs were tasteless) and I got the salmon while my friend got the hot chicken with coleslaw/mac & cheese.  Hot chicken was the way to go.....I picked off her plate and barely touched the salmon, which was just ok.  Here's a hint:  train your servers to be positive and show enthusiasm about the cuisine.   Gets two stars for wine Monday otherwise 1.

5eO1dqzVId3TScIhbZ9B1A.text: Jonathan and the Pork Belly were a dynamic pair during my midday break uptown!  Tasty local Blue Blaze recommendation was on point & the service was fit for a Queen! Kristin have that baby alreadyThis is an all around winner in every way!

4WuTZ_VnmQHcWVS0112xpA.text: I brunched my mom here on their very first Saturday! Staff was awesome and the food was even better. Great location uptown and excellent addition to our city! Anthony, you've done a fantastic job, congrats on the success!!

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Saturday Brunch!

O5Lin44yR6Alu1BjRWYQpw.text: This restaurant is just ok. Their craft cocktails were not craft! Check out The Cellar at Duckworth for the real deal! The fried green tomatoes were too dry but the fried oysters were decent. I had the flat iron streak, which was cooked medium to my liking but my hubby's Mahi was a flavorless soupy mess. The sticky bun dessert was the best part of the meal. Atmosphere is cool but I'd stick to dessert and maybe a beer.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vodka tonic and Amazing Grace. Blah

Zargb_39ypFMDfl6zrwkfA.text: I went for Mother's Day brunch this morning and it was delicious! We had the deviled eggs, they were incredible! I ordered one to go and I've been looking for a recipe every since I left. I had the Butcher's omelet with caramelized onions instead of jalapenos and omg! So good. My mom got the farmer's omelet and she loved it as did my dad with his home fry skillet. Orlando was our waiter and he was incredible! Very nice and attentive to his tables. If I lived in town I would already be back for dinner!

LurfrQ5E4ZZJsR6uq3-suQ.text: So rainy night ran into first cool looking spot and was greeted by Alicia.  Dazzling smile was matched by her great service and outstanding food served! Deviled eggs and Meatloaf on same menu is a statement!  Was not disappointed!  Check it out and ask for Alicia!

rPxu5Ffaw6ZmXfgSHHvofQ.text: We live in Uptown, so we were anxious to try 204. Fortunately our initial impression did not follow through the evening. When we arrived, the hostess did not look up from her iPad. She stood sideways to us, no greeting, no eye contact, nothing. It wasn't until I looked at my husband and said,"invisible syndrome", did she even acknowledge that we were there. We told her we had reservations and she picked up 2 menus and walked away. We looked at each other, like, "are we supposed to follow her?" She turned around and looked at us, as if we should be mind readers. At that point I imagined the worst. Fortunately, it got much better.   The decor is very nice with beautiful wood floors, brick walls, and an industrial feel. The music is at a good level so you can communicate without yelling. Our server, Mikaela, was pleasant, attentive, and helpful. We enjoy good food, and I have always been an adventurous cook, so we are pretty happy eating a good meal at home on the balcony enjoying the skyline. If we eat out, we expect it to taste good and be memorable, or what's the point?  I ordered the Mahi Mahi, and it was very good. The asparagus, rice, and fish were cooked perfectly, and were not over salted (one of my pet peeves). My husband had the meatloaf, and enjoyed it too and said the green beans and mashed potatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly. We are not big dessert people, but ordered the key lime pie, which was not on the online menu yet... also very good and worth the calorie splurge.   If I had gone by the unwelcoming attitude of the hostess, I would have just walked out and we would have missed a very nice meal. My husband, the nicest guy ever, said, "she is sucky as a hostess." Sadly, if someone doesn't explain to this young woman how to be hospitable, there will be people who won't take the time to find out the potential this place has. I hope they do well, because it is always nice to have a reliable go-to spot you enjoy within walking distance.

liMyIVbSb0W2masG6zlCNA.text: Our dinner last night was unbelievably good. We had the pork chop and flatiron steak. Both were seasoned and cooked to perfection. Our waiter did an amazing job of getting us from our 5:30pm reservation and out the door to our show at 7pm at the Blumenthal.   Would 100% go back.

jz2e_uQrQ8Q3mDikK4oCRw.text: Finally got a chance to have a full meal here after having been to a pretty awesome Christmas Party upstairs!  Wow! Just wow! The hostess MJ is all personality with a lot of spunk. She was a total mind reader and gave our group some prime real estate at the front of the restaurant. You know ... the cozy one in the window with perfect lighting and a great view for people watching.  Then we met AJ, our waiter - suave, debonair and very attentive. He helped us go through the menu and made some excellent suggestions for both apps and dinner.  There's a great draught beer list with some of my local faves like Higher Ground (Birdsong) and Juicy Jay (Legion) - but for those you that like wine or cocktails, the list of selections is incredible. I did sneak a taste of a cocktail called the Dilworth that could easily convince me to become a cocktail drinker!  To start: The Nashville Chicken Sliders had just the right amount of heat and were super delicious. Oh and those deviled eggs with the crispy fried oysters on top - just add a little Sriracha and you've got the perfect bite.  Main Course: Our group passed around our plates so we could try some of each dish - Tagliatelle with Shrimp, Apple Brined Pork Chop with Sweet Potato Puree/Succotash and the House Burger, the 204 Cheeseburger.  So glad we did that because it was tough to pick a winner. The Pork Chop was probably my favorite but ooooh that 6 Hour Marinara on the Tagliatelle (and massive amounts of yummy Burrata). But wait, that was a pretty killer burger too - two grass fed patties, caramelized onions, heirloom tomato, house made pickles and the 204 Sauce. Crazy good!! Okay, so maybe it's a three way tie...  So is it time to go to lunch yet? ... 204 North Kitchen me please!!

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States

E-iPU5UHOU3Vgq0sC_5b6A.text: Recently went for dinner and had a great experience.  Early Friday dinner (cause that's how we roll)... so we had our pick of the tables, luckily we were there early enough to pick out the window table with a ton of natural light (better for food photos ;).  The hostess MJ was super welcoming and seated us promptly and also introduced us to our server AJ... I think it was pure coincidence that the staff were all two-lettered names, but we had a good laugh about it.  AJ was a great server and we picked is brain over the menu.  We decided on deviled eggs and Nashville sliders for our starters and then the pork chop, tagliatelle (w/Shrimp), and the 204 Cheeseburger.  Everything was delicious and very "insta" worthy.  Lots of drink options here.  Started with beer, but ended up trying the Dilworth which was pretty refreshing and went with all the food.  Luckily some crazy person I was with brought their own drink umbrella, so our photos got even fancier.  Even though we were super early for dinner, the restaurant eventually filled up - so make sure to make your reservations here if you dine in "prime time".  Everything on the menu sounded delicious, so I need to go back and try one of everything.

photos.caption: Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Chop
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. 204 Cheeseburger
Photo of 204 North Kitchen & Cocktails - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tagliatelle with Shrimp

gFhEeEgm92HQA3epJ1DawA.text: When I have tickets for a show Uptown my first thought is Nashville Hot Chicken Sliders from 204 North. That's normal right? I love their bar upstairs and their bartenders make balanced, delicious cocktails.   It seems like burgers are strong on the menu game right now and 204's burger is as my niece says, bangin.   Menu Cut and Paste Time, cue the music.  two grass fed beef patties, american cheese, caramelized onions, bibb lettuce, heirloom tomato, house quick pickles & 204 sauce, served with parmesan fries $16  I just had the burger last night and I could totally eat another one right now! I wonder what time they open?

kVNxr3wIVP0q_zfk9d0ngA.text: Food 3.5  Value 4 Service 4 Decor 4   While our server was extremely charismatic and sweet, I wish he was more knowledgeable about their wine list -- he didn't know the prices or the specifics of what the 50% deal was for. It was for any bottle over $40, but he thought there wasn't a minimum spend. This is something I would expect servers to know considering it's an advertised special, which is also displayed on the sidewalk chalkboard outside the restaurant. Additionally, he didn't know about the wines themselves. Having said that, he was extremely attentive to our table which we greatly appreciated.   My friends and I ordered : Appetizers-    - Charcuterie + cheese plate - sopressata and proscuitto tasted a bit 'old' like it  had been pre-sliced for a while. It ate on the dry side. Grapes were super fresh though.   - Calamari- standard; nothing special   - Devilled eggs - has a fried oyster on top! The flavor of the egg itself was a bit underwhelming but it was a unique bite with the oyster   - Beet salad- SUPER refreshing and the perfect amount of goat cheese. I would reorder this!  - Seared scallops- best appetizer by far. They were seared to perfection and full of flavor. Get this!!!   Entrees-  - Tagliatelle with burrata - the burrata looked  beautiful but was not as creamy as I'd like. The tagliatelle was EXTREMELY overcooked- I mean, it was soggy and borderline mushy. The server was very nice and knew something was wrong as we took 2 bites and couldn't eat anymore. They removed the tagliatelle from the bill.   - Burger - nothing special   Long story short, get the beet salad + seared scallops.
